channel.title: scope1 – Solar Anamnesis
channel.description: Scenes from the Solar System's Youth

item.title: D’Orbigny Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: This is a thin section specimen of the D’Orbigny Meteorite. The thin section photographs were taken under cross polarized light using two linear polarizing filters. The first set of pictures is from a nicer CCD and microscope. For a good link to more Angrite pictures, see here. Angrites always look spectacular in polarized light. Link […]

item.title: Pasamonte Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: Taken in cross polarized light, this is a remarkably beautiful thin section of the Pasamonte Meteorite. The Pasamonte Meteorite is famous in history as the first observed fall to be photographed. Harvey Nininger played an important role in cataloging and recovering many of the specimens currently located in museums and private collections. The Pasamonte Meteorite […]

item.title: NWA 8687 Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: NWA 8687 Lunar Troctolite Meteorite. View Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View and interact with image on Gigapan | View Panorama with krpano Purchase Prints Visit Store

item.title: Allende Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: Thin section specimen of the Allende meteorite. Carbonaceous chondrite with numerous Calcium-Aluminum-Inclusions (CAIs). More information at Marmet Meteorites. View Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: Interact with this image on Gigapan | View Panorama with krpano (Preferred) Purchase Prints Visit Store
